org.simplity.tp

Class BatchRowProcessor.ChildProcess

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.simplity.tp.BatchRowProcessor.ChildProcess
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DbRowProcessor
    Enclosing class:
    BatchRowProcessor

    protected class BatchRowProcessor.ChildProcess
extends Object
    child processor processes rows for a given parent row on each call.
    Author:
    simplity.org

      • excpetionOnCallBack

        protected Exception excpetionOnCallBack
        very tricky design because of call-back design. In case a child-level row processing throws an exception, we can not propagate it back properly. Hence we keep track of that with this state-variable

      • callBackOnDbRow

        public boolean callBackOnDbRow(String[] outputNames,
                               Value[] values)
        when sql is used, this is how we get called back on each row in the result
        Specified by:
        callBackOnDbRow in interface DbRowProcessor
        Returns:
        true if all OK, and the process should continue; false means we are not interested in any more rows, and teh driver can stop processing any remaining rows

      • callFromParent

        protected int callFromParent()
                      throws Exception
        recursive call from a parent-processor. We have to process rows in this file/sql for current parent row.
        Throws:
        Exception
